result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carl Adam Thomas

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: 10:01 a.m.  Court calls Case #s 22CF32 and 22CF33 from Ashland, WI via Zoom. Attorney Matthew J Tingstad in court for State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Tyler William Wickman in court for Carl Adam Thomas.  Attorney M. Joseph Rafferty Jr. in court for Carl Adam Thomas.  Defendant Carl Adam Thomas in court. Here today for preliminary hearings on both cases.   10:02 a.m.  Prelim begins on Case #22CF33.  DA calls Sgt Max Samardich to testify.  He is sworn in by clerk.  Direct by DA.  Officer Samardich testifies.  10:15 a.m.  Cross by atty. Wickman.  Court ends cross questioning of atty. Wickman.  Atty. Wickman makes record as to writing of test results.  10:21 a.m.  Re-direct by DA.  No re-cross.  Statement by DA asking for bindover.  No argument from defense.  Court finds probable cause that defendant has committed a felony and case is bound over.  DA states Information will be filed within a week.  Arraignment set for 11/07/22 at 8:30 a.m.  Everyone may appear by Zoom.  wmg
Defendant's Request for Substitution of Judge
Preliminary hearing on October 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

8:39 a.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Judge McKnight appears with CR via Zoom from Ashland County.  Def appears with Attys. Rafferty and Wickland from Atty Rafferty's office via Zoom.  WTLPH on file.  Prelims to be set in both cases for 10/13 at 10:00 a.m. for 30 minutes.  Def will most likely be in person.  If an emergency or def unable to appear in person, def can appear via Zoom as long as video appearance.  Adj.  8:41 a.m.  klr
Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on June 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Court calls case, cites appearances.  Def appears via Zoom with Atty Rafferty and Atty Wickman from Atty Rafferty's office.  Bond has already been set.  Def waives reading of the complaint and WTLPH.  PTC to be set for 6/30 at 9:00 a.m.  Adj.  10:27 a.m.  klr

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 000555,
Payable Number: 35902,
Receipt Number: 22R 000945,
Amount: $20.00

01/31/22 at 10:37 a.m.   PC/BOND HEARING:  Def in person, in custody.  PC statement given to court.  Right to atty explained.  Def thinks he will qualify for public def.  Court explains PC process.  Def understands.  Officer Max Samardich sworn, direct by DA.  Officer identifies def.  Discussion regarding PBT.  Court questions officer.  10:45 a.m.  Court finds PC for OWI 7th.  State requests $1,000 cash bond with conditions of no possession/consumption of alcohol or controlled substances.  Def argues he's not a flight risk.  Requests a sig bond.  Works at Ashland Industries for 6 years.  Court questions def.  Court sets bond at $1,000 cash bond.  Def shall not drive a motor veh, no alcohol or CTs w/out valid prescription.  2/7 at 9:00 a.m. for Initial Appearance.  Adj.  10:53 a.m.  klr
